# Machine Learning Notes

A comprehensive collection of machine learning concepts, lectures, and hands-on projects. This site serves as a structured learning resource covering fundamental ML algorithms, mathematical foundations, and practical implementations.

**Live Site**: [https://sanjanb.github.io/Machine-Learning/](https://sanjanb.github.io/Machine-Learning/)

## ğŸ¯ What You'll Find Here

- **Lectures**: Step-by-step explanations of key machine learning concepts
- **Topics**: Deep dives into algorithms like linear/logistic regression, gradient descent, and cost functions
- **Projects**: Hands-on implementations with Jupyter notebooks and real datasets
- **References**: Curated collection of essential books and research papers
- **Foundations**: Mathematical and statistical prerequisites

## ğŸš€ Quick Start

### For Learners

1. Start with the [Syllabus](https://sanjanb.github.io/Machine-Learning/intro/syllabus.html)
2. Review [Foundations](https://sanjanb.github.io/Machine-Learning/Foundations/) for prerequisites
3. Follow [Lectures](https://sanjanb.github.io/Machine-Learning/pages/lectures/) in sequence
4. Practice with [Projects](https://sanjanb.github.io/Machine-Learning/projects/)
5. Explore [Topics](https://sanjanb.github.io/Machine-Learning/topics/) for detailed explanations

### For Developers

```bash
# Clone and setup
git clone https://github.com/sanjanb/Machine-Learning.git
cd Machine-Learning
bundle install
pip install jupyter nbconvert

# Run locally
jekyll serve --livereload
```
